Articles.Content:
Awesome! I wish I could have physics like that, mommy!

And staging, and so on.

But it's a good picture for a kids book.

Something wrong?

Do you even stage bro
I use shuttles primarily. Do not understand question.
What is this? There's no context, no explanation, and no pertinence to the subforum as it has nothing to do with KSP and isn't player-made.

What is this? There's no context, no explanation, and no pertinence to the subforum as it has nothing to do with KSP and isn't player-made.

Was simply pointing out how in the picture SLS seems to be outside the atmosphere with no staging parts detached, still flying on solid rocket boosters, with ISS and an asteroid "nearby". The image is obviously funny to people who are the least bit interested in space travel, and I placed it on the Kerbal Network to begin with, a mod chose to move it here.

Was simply pointing out how in the picture SLS seems to be outside the atmosphere with no staging parts detached, still flying on solid rocket boosters, with ISS and an asteroid "nearby". The image is obviously funny to people who are the least bit interested in space travel, and I placed it on the Kerbal Network to begin with, a mod chose to move it here.

You weren't pointing it out at all. The only bit of information presented was an ambiguous "Uhm".

how in the picture SLS seems to be outside the atmosphere with no staging parts detached, still flying on solid rocket boosters, with ISS and an asteroid "nearby". The image is obviously funny to people who are the least bit interested in space travel, and I placed it on the Kerbal Network to begin with, a mod chose to move it here.

The only person that would get mad over something like this would certainly need to be extremely pedantic. It's obviously an infographic or poster advertising something and is intended to display information, not an accurate depiction of spaceflight. You remind me of someone I don't like, whom I've had the unfortunate liberty of meeting in real life.
No need to get nasty over it. Dial back the ill-temper, please.

Was simply pointing out how in the picture SLS seems to be outside the atmosphere with no staging parts detached, still flying on solid rocket boosters, with ISS and an asteroid "nearby". The image is obviously funny to people who are the least bit interested in space travel, and I placed it on the Kerbal Network to begin with, a mod chose to move it here.

This picture is nothing more than hype, may even be done by JPL itself as a publicity gimmick or may even be someone's digital art from DeviantArt. While I do understand More Booster's many problems with the picture, I do not think there is a need to get nasty about it.

Maybe we need to create a new thread, "Stupid things we see in sci-fi movies et al." and stick this picture in there...
